noun.description: The elected executive head of a state of the US.
The head of a public institution.
examples: the governor of the Bank of England

noun.description: The person in authority; one's employer.
A device automatically regulating the supply of fuel, steam, or water to a machine, ensuring uniform motion or limiting speed.

origin: Middle English: from Old French governeour, from Latin gubernator, from gubernare (see govern).
